hero.core_tension: Decide to replace a weekend 20% sitewide discount with a partner-led in-store activation within one planning cycle; choose speed versus scale of markdown.
hero.setting: Back-of-store planning table facing the storefront; laminated pilot boards, partner mockups, and a folded store map on a matte wood table.
hero.action: Signing off on a 6-week S1 pilot: swap one weekend 20% sitewide discount for a co-branded in-store activation across 12 pilot stores.
hero.urgency_symbol: A sharp band of directional light cutting the table surface to imply a narrowing holiday window (symbolic closing moment).
props: S1 pilot plan board (12 stores, 6 weeks)
Co-branded activation mockup referencing S2 exclusive drop possibilities
Printed P&L snapshot flagging event_cpa targets from S3
hero.lighting: Polished editorial lighting, confident highlights, soft shadow negative space.
hero.alt: Head of Retail signing off on S1 6-week pilot replacing a weekend discount with co-branded activations.

signal_map.structure: Concentric rings (baseline to stretch) with radial arcs for time windows and node clusters for stores; two labeled goal bands embedded in the rings.
elements: Store tokens sized by expected footfall
Arcs labeled with baseline and goal numbers (10-15% -> â‰¥25%)
Nodes tagged for week-one drop windows and activation dates
signal_map.motion: Flow compresses toward a bright lane representing the early-window demand pulse; vectors show customer funnel velocity into week-one.
signal_map.palette: Neutral editorial base, warm gold for baseline bands, vivid teal for goal/ stretch bands, matte metallic accents.
signal_map.alt: Head of Partnerships and Head of Retail viewing a signal map encoding footfall uplift and early-window share targets.

case_study_1.scene: High-traffic store front corner staged as a mini drop with limited-stock pedestal and branded co-presentation.
case_study_1.moment: First-hour cadence: team funnels footfall to the drop, physical queue tokens and staff prompts convert early buys.
props: Numbered physical queue tokens to imply measured early-window demand
Co-brand signage hinting at partner-funded pricing
case_study_1.lighting: Editorial spotlight on product pedestal, deep negative space around the crowd to isolate the drop moment.
case_study_1.alt: Head of Partnerships launching a week-one exclusive drop test to lift early-window share.

case_study_2.scene: Small strategy huddle at a long table with P&L sheets, two scenario stacks labeled '20% blanket' and '15% co-funded', and a partner term sheet.
case_study_2.moment: CFO and Head of Partnerships compare modeled event_cpa and partner_value to decide funding mix before pilot roll-out.
props: Printed P&L scenarios contrasting blanket discount vs co-funded collaboration (S3)
Partner term sheet and marginal margin callouts
Simple physical ledger tokens representing partner contributions
case_study_2.lighting: Cool, even editorial highlights for clarity, subtle rim light on documents.
case_study_2.alt: CFO and Head of Partnerships modeling P&L tradeoffs for co-funded 15% collaboration vs 20% discount.

future_outlook.scene: Front-of-store display wall arranged like a scoreboard: stacked sales tags, footfall tokens, and a cleared product lane showing conversion flow.
future_outlook.moment: Post-pilot review where the team confirms the collab-led holiday approach met stretch targets and replaces the blanket markdown playbook.
props: Physical success tokens labeled with metric anchors (footfall +%, early-window %)
A resolved activation route from storefront to checkout representing buyer activity share
Co-branded signage folded into a long-form merchandising run
future_outlook.lighting: Confident editorial light with a calm highlight band sweeping the display to imply an achieved window.
future_outlook.mood: Confident, evidence-driven, operationally ready to scale.
future_outlook.alt: Head of Retail reviewing pilot results: foot traffic +25% and early-window share 28% after collab activations.
